Generated by cloudfront (CloudFront) Request ID: C_tJjotJoAE1lPbgud9WN2imLGBBLvxbgctUoe_1uVXWgMIAQ9_gAw==

title: Text blurred and websites locked in other browsers.
content: Hi, Firefox has been my go to browser for years because of its reliability. I recently allowed Firefox to update to Firefox 97. The text became very blurred. I adjusted ClearType Text. This did not improve matters and worsened clarity for other browsers. I deleted Firefox, moved to other Chrome and Edge, and found that something was blocking many websites most but not all of the time. I tried everything I could think of to fix by changing browser settings particularly disabling or deleting add-ons. Ultimately the only way I could restore function was to restore the laptop to what it was before updating to Firefox 97 including loss of some files particularly emails. The problems started with the update to F97. I am now using F96 and am too concerned to update it. Can F97 cause such problems, is it safe for me to stick with F96, is it now safe to update to F97 or should I just move to other browsers. Any guidance would be appreciated. Regards David

title: IMPORTACION DE CONTRASEÑAS

El problema con el que me encuentro, es que Firefox me da la opción de importar las contraseñas desde otro navegador, pero no veo la forma de hacerlo con un fichero .csv generado por la aplicación gestora. ¿Hay alguna forma de hacer dicha importación? Gracias.

title: Unable to set Firefox as default in Windows 11
content:
Hi, I'm trying to run and use Firefox as my default browser on Windows 11, but I'm running into some issues. The device is managed by Microsoft Family, which blocks Firefox by default. I got around this by renaming "firefox.exe" to something else. This works to get Firefox open, but the modified filename is causing Windows to not recognize it as a browser. As a result, I can't get Firefox set as the default for http/https.

I've tried tools like SetDefaultBrowser from Christoph Kolbicz but no success, it is unable to notice that firefox no longer exists as "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe"

Anyone have any advice on how to fix this? Windows seems adamant not to let me set the http/https protocols to anything it doesn't think is a browser (i.e. my Firefox installation).
creator: coloradosjones

title: banking login not working
content:
I am frequently having problems trying to log in to online bank Simplii Financial. My internet connection is good, FF (88.0) is able to connect to other sites. Other browsers (Opera, Chrome etc ) could all connect and allow my login. With FF it simply continues loading with no result. i have asked the bank to check their FF certificates? and they say there is no problem - just use another browser! Firefox is my main browser, the only one that can save my login details. This problem is sporadic but has been going on for several months. It may be connected with FF updates but I am om the latest version for my Linux distribution I believe. 

 At one time FF would never connect to PC Optimum whereas other browsers did, that problem was somehow solved.

title: Firefox trying to connect to facebook directly even though i have a proxy setup
content:
I am trying to use my university internet connection on my pc and in order for it to connect the traffic has to go through a proxy server provided by them. I have configured the proxy in system settings and Proxifier. I even tried configuring it manually on Firefox. But for some reason Firefox keeps trying to send the Facebook traffic directly through the connection instead of using the proxy. As far as I can tell Facebook is the only site this is happening and connecting to any other website works fine. Connecting to Facebook using other browsers forks fine as well.

PS:- Just found out this issue is not limited to facebook. Firefox tries to directly connect to every site that uses a cdn server.

title: apparent bug in v97 on win10
content:
Since I've loaded v97.0 onto my two win10 installations I've noticed a bug that I think I've figured out what's going wrong: for several sites I visit [e.g., faceblook] I scroll down a long way, just idly scanning it. I'd noticed that several times the screen would go completely blank. What seems to be triggering it is if the site gets an update while I'm scrolling deep into its feed, FF just blanks the screen. I'd prefer that FF just ignored that and let me continue scrolling, instead of having to control-R to get the page reappear [at the top, of course] and then have to fight my way down to where I was.

Anyone else seeing this kind of behavior? 

  /Bernie\

title: use a link to change focus to another tab and scroll to a anchor tag with a named ID
content:
I am creating a webpage that has a list of links in one table that are used to go to a specific point in another table using <A href='#identifier'> in the link and <A id='identifier'> in the target table. The list is very long, so I am creating the list of links in a separate document until it is completed. Until then, I test the links by having the link href set to 'webpage.html#identifier', but all this ends up doing is opening another tab and reloading the page when it's already open in a different tab. I am using the target='_blank' attribute to go to another tab, but I'm sure this isn't the proper way to do it.

Is there a way to use a link to go to an already open tab and perform the search for the identifier in that tab rather than opening a new tab and reloading the page repeatedly?
creator: WayneCa
